Articles.Content:
The 750 unit monopropellant tank that i have on one of my ships isnt fueling the RCS thrusters, ill run outta mono in those but the big tank is still completely full. Everything worked until the 1.0.5 update..

Anyone else having this issue or have any ideas?
That's very strange. Do you have a picture of the spacecraft?

Is the tank enabled? Right-click on the tank, if the pop-up window has a small red circle icon click on it to toggle the tank on.

Alternatively, the game takes staging into account and tries to use up monoprop tanks that will be discarded next before draining tanks that will be kept longer. I think. Could that be it?

yea, the tank is enabled, i even went back and added fuel transfer pipes to the fuel tanks the RCS thrusters are on (never had to do that before but i figured why not give it a shot)

the ship is the mechjeb pod, 1 adapter fuel tank, and 4 small fuel tanks (all stock) 4 poodle engines, i cant remember the name of the thrusters, 2 batteries, solar arrays, a heat sink and radiators (mod), and a docking port at the bottom since this is basically my delivery craft to land stuff on other planets with no atmosphere.

http://i1251.photobucket.com/albums/hh546/crash1187/Untitled_zps3uczuqil.png' alt='Untitled_zps3uczuqil.png'>

this set up (minus the extra tank under the mechjeb (i added it to see if the mechjeb would pull from it if it was attached directly to a mono tank, it didnt) worked fine before the update
I only see Vernor RCS that uses LFO. Where's your mono consumer?

On 11/14/2015, 4:03:48, FancyMouse said:

I only see Vernor RCS that uses LFO. Where's your mono consumer?

ah, i didnt pay attention to the fuel type. Thanks!

 

Now i just wish there was a tank for the mechjeb (i know, lazy, but right now im more focused on building stuff than I am with piloting it)
